item.title: Will SD-WAN Eat MPLS?
item.description:
SD-WAN, a trending service, is considered a potential alternative to MPLS networks, with cost comparisons hinting at a potential shift similar to how MPLS replaced Frame Relay. The Need for Network Solutions Computer networking is crucial in today’s world, connecting various devices like desktops, laptops, tablets, and even specialized equipment. This interconnectedness is vital for both basic functionality and accessing cloud-based applications. Traditional Networking Solutions Private point-to-point circuits offer complete network control and high performance but come with high costs and lengthy setup times...

item.title: SD-WAN is Your Super LAN
item.description:
By: John Shepler The current trend of companies moving their technology and communications systems to cloud-based providers is significant. While this migration offers many benefits, it presents a challenge: establishing reliable connections over long distances, which is much more complex than using a simple ethernet cable. The Expanding Digital Landscape The internet has evolved from a platform for text and images to one that encompasses video, e-commerce, and now, remote applications, databases, and unified communications...
